definition: to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: Many sections and chapters of acupuncture and moxibustion in The Yellow Emperor's Internal Classic contain a principle of pulse taking.
sentences.chinese: 《內經》的許多鍼灸篇章中都蘊藏着一個診脈原則。

sentences.english: During pulse-taking, the patient should relax himself, breathe naturally, and keep in calm.
sentences.chinese: 診脈時患者應該放鬆，呼吸平穩，情緒穩定。

sentences.english: The doctor felt his pulse and gave him a prescription.
sentences.chinese: 醫生爲他診脈並開立藥方。

sentences.english: He felt the patient's pulse and noticed that it accelerated slightly.
sentences.chinese: 他給病人診脈，發現病人脈搏稍爲加快了。

definition: lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
